intro: Hieracium apoloense, commonly known as the APOLOENSE hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped, while its flowers are yellow with ray florets. Hieracium apoloense is often found in the Andes, where it plays a role in the local ecosystem.
